meanings.definition: To serve as a cochair in a meeting or organization.
meanings.sent1: During the meeting, Sarah and John cochairs the discussion.
meanings.sent2: The team cochairs the event to ensure smooth coordination.
meanings.sent3: As the only two available, they had to cochairs the important presentation.
meanings.sent4: Sarah and John's ability to cochairs effectively makes them a dynamic duo.
meanings.sent5: The way they cochairs together shows great teamwork and collaboration.

meanings.definition: The act of sharing the position of chair with another person.
meanings.sent1: In the committee, Sarah and John are the cochairs of the project.
meanings.sent2: The cochairs work closely to lead the organization towards success.
meanings.sent3: Being cochairs means sharing both responsibilities and achievements.
meanings.sent4: The two cochairs steer the team with unity and harmony.
meanings.sent5: Their role as cochairs highlights the importance of cooperation and partnership.
